<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    For the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
    stock-based compensation expense included in net income is net
    of tax benefits of $9.8&#160;million, $4.6&#160;million and
    $2.0&#160;million, respectively. Similarly, stock-based
    compensation expense determined under the fair value based
    method for the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003
    is net of tax benefits of $11.4&#160;million, $8.0&#160;million
    and $6.6&#160;million, respectively. See Note&#160;P for
    additional information regarding the Company&#146;s income taxes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Foreign currency translation.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The
    U.S.&#160;dollar is the functional currency for all of the
    Company&#146;s international operations except Canada.
    Accordingly, monetary assets and liabilities denominated in a
    foreign currency are remeasured to U.S.&#160;dollars at the
    exchange rate in effect at the end of each reporting period;
    revenues and costs and expenses denominated in a foreign
    currency are remeasured at the average of the exchange rates
    that were in effect during the period in which the revenues and
    costs and expenses were recognized. The resulting gains or
    losses from remeasuring foreign currency denominated balances
    into U.S.&#160;dollars are recorded in other income or other
    expense, respectively. Nonmonetary assets and liabilities
    denominated in a foreign currency are remeasured at the historic
    exchange rates that were in effect when the assets or
    liabilities were acquired or incurred.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The functional currency of the Company&#146;s Canadian
    operations is the Canadian dollar. The financial statements of
    the Company&#146;s Canadian subsidiary entities are translated
    to U.S.&#160;dollars as follows: all assets and liabilities are
    translated using the exchange rate in effect at the end of each
    reporting period; revenues and costs and expenses are translated
    using the average of the exchange rates that were in effect
    during the period in which the revenues and costs and expenses
    were recognized. The resulting gains or losses from translating
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">non-U.S.&#160;dollar</FONT>
    denominated balances are recorded in the accompanying
    Consolidated Statements of Stockholders&#146; Equity for the
    period through accumulated other comprehensive income
    (loss)&#160;&#151;&#160;cumulative translation adjustment.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    77
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Reclassifications.</I></B>&#160;&#160;Certain
    reclassifications have been made to the 2004 and 2003 amounts in
    order to conform with the 2005 presentation. Specifically, the
    Company reduced cash used for additions to oil and gas
    properties included in investing activities and the add-back of
    exploration expenses in operating activities in the accompanying
    Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows by approximately
    $53.0&#160;million and $25.6&#160;million for the years ended
    December&#160;31, 2004 and 2003, respectively, representing
    reclassifications of geological expenses incurred in the related
    periods.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>New accounting pronouncements.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The
    following discussions provide information about new accounting
    pronouncements that have been issued by the FASB:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>SFAS&#160;123(R).</I>&#160;&#160;In December 2004, the FASB
    issued SFAS&#160;123(R), which is a revision of SFAS&#160;123.
    SFAS&#160;123(R) supersedes APB&#160;25 and amends
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;95, &#147;Statement of Cash Flows&#148;.
    Generally, the approach in SFAS&#160;123(R) is similar to the
    approach described in SFAS&#160;123. However, SFAS&#160;123(R)
    will require all share-based payments to employees, including
    grants of employee stock options, to be recognized as
    stock-based compensation expense in the Company&#146;s
    Consolidated Statements of Operations based on their fair
    values. Pro forma disclosure is no longer an alternative.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    SFAS&#160;123(R) must be adopted no later than January&#160;1,
    2006 and permits public companies to adopt its requirements
    using one of two methods:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    A &#147;modified prospective&#148; method in which compensation
    cost is recognized beginning with the effective date based on
    the requirements of SFAS&#160;123(R) for all share-based
    payments granted after the adoption date and based on the
    requirements of SFAS&#160;123 for all awards granted to
    employees prior to the effective date of SFAS&#160;123(R) that
    remain unvested on the adoption date.
</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    A &#147;modified retrospective&#148; method which includes the
    requirements of the modified prospective method described above,
    but also permits entities to restate either all prior periods
    presented or prior interim periods of the year of adoption based
    on the amounts previously recognized under SFAS&#160;123 for
    purposes of pro forma disclosures.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company adopted the provisions of SFAS&#160;123(R) on
    January&#160;1, 2006 using the modified prospective method.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As permitted by SFAS&#160;123, the Company accounted for
    share-based payments to employees prior to January&#160;1, 2006
    using the intrinsic value method prescribed by APB&#160;25 and
    related interpretations. As such, the Company generally did not
    recognize compensation expense associated with employee stock
    option grants. The Company has not issued stock options to
    employees since 2003. Consequently, the adoption of
    SFAS&#160;123(R)&#146;s fair value method will not have a
    significant impact on the Company&#146;s future results of
    operations or financial position. Had the Company adopted
    SFAS&#160;123(R) in prior periods, the impact would have
    approximated the impact of SFAS&#160;123 as described in the pro
    forma disclosures above. The adoption of SFAS&#160;123(R) will
    have no effect on future results of operations related to the
    Company&#146;s unvested outstanding restricted stock awards. The
    Company estimates that the adoption of SFAS&#160;123(R), based
    on estimated outstanding unvested stock options, will result in
    compensation charges of approximately $1.0&#160;million during
    2006.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    78
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (the
    &#147;ESPP&#148;) that allows eligible employees to annually
    purchase the Company&#146;s common stock at a discount. The
    provisions of SFAS&#160;123(R) will cause the ESPP to be a
    compensatory plan. However, the change in accounting for the
    ESPP is not expected to have a material impact on the
    Company&#146;s financial position, future results of operations
    or liquidity. Historically, the ESPP compensatory amounts have
    been nominal. See Note&#160;H for additional information
    regarding the ESPP.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    SFAS&#160;123(R) also requires that tax benefits in excess of
    recognized compensation expenses be reported as a financing cash
    flow, rather than an operating cash flow as required under prior
    literature. This requirement may serve to reduce the
    Company&#146;s future cash flows from operating activities and
    increase future cash flows from financing activities, to the
    extent of associated tax benefits that may be realized in the
    future.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>FSP
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">FAS&#160;19-1.</FONT></I>&#160;&#160;In
    April 2005, the FASB issued FSP
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">FAS&#160;19-1.</FONT>
    FSP
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">FAS&#160;19-1</FONT>
    amended SFAS&#160;19, to allow continued capitalization of
    exploratory well costs beyond one year from the completion of
    drilling under circumstances where the well has found a
    sufficient quantity of reserves to justify its completion as a
    producing well and the enterprise is making sufficient progress
    assessing the reserves and the economic and operating viability
    of the project. FSP
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">FAS&#160;19-1</FONT>
    also amended SFAS&#160;19 to require enhanced disclosures of
    suspended exploratory well costs in the notes to the
    consolidated financial statements. The Company adopted the new
    requirements during the second quarter of 2005. See Note&#160;D
    for additional information regarding the Company&#146;s
    exploratory well costs. The adoption of FSP
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">FAS&#160;19-1</FONT>
    did not impact the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
    position or results of operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;C.&#160;&#160;Acquisitions</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Evergreen merger.</I></B>&#160;&#160;On September&#160;28,
    2004, Pioneer completed a merger with Evergreen, with Pioneer
    being the surviving corporation for accounting purposes. The
    transaction was accounted for as a purchase of Evergreen by
    Pioneer. The merger with Evergreen was accomplished through the
    issuance of 25.4&#160;million shares of Pioneer common stock and
    $851.1&#160;million of cash paid to Evergreen shareholders at
    closing, net of $12.1&#160;million of acquired cash. The cash
    consideration paid in the merger was financed through borrowings
    on the Company&#146;s unsecured revolving credit facilities. See
    Note&#160;F for additional information regarding the credit
    facilities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company recorded $327.8&#160;million of goodwill associated
    with the Evergreen merger, which represented the excess of the
    purchase consideration over the net fair value of the
    identifiable net assets acquired.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    79
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following unaudited pro forma combined condensed financial
    data for the years ended December&#160;31, 2004 and 2003 were
    derived from the historical financial statements of Pioneer and
    Evergreen giving effect to the merger as if the merger had
    occurred on January&#160;1, 2003. The unaudited pro forma
    combined condensed financial data have been included for
    comparative purposes only, are not necessarily indicative of the
    results that might have occurred had the merger taken place on
    January&#160;1, 2003 and are not intended to be a projection of
    future results.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Permian Basin and Gulf Coast
    acquisitions.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During 2005, the Company spent
    $176.9&#160;million to acquire various working interests in the
    Spraberry and South Texas areas, including the assumption of
    approximately $3.0&#160;million in asset retirement obligations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Falcon acquisitions.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During March 2003,
    the Company purchased the remaining 25&#160;percent working
    interest that it did not already own in the Falcon field, the
    Harrier field and surrounding satellite prospects in the
    deepwater Gulf of Mexico for $120.4&#160;million, including
    $114.1&#160;million of cash, $1.7&#160;million of asset
    retirement obligations assumed and $4.6&#160;million of closing
    adjustments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;D.&#160;&#160;Exploratory
    Well Costs</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company capitalizes exploratory well costs until a
    determination is made that the well has either found proved
    reserves or that it is impaired. The capitalized exploratory
    well costs are presented in proved properties in the
    Consolidated Balance Sheets. If the exploratory well is
    determined to be impaired, the well costs are charged to expense.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    80
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table provides the capitalized costs of
    exploration projects that have been suspended for more than one
    year as of December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="66%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="6%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following discussion describes the history and status of
    each significant suspended exploratory project:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Ozona Deep.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s Ozona
    Deep exploration well was drilled during 2002 and found
    quantities of oil believed to be commercial; however, given its
    location in the Gulf of Mexico, it is necessary to have a signed
    production handling agreement (&#147;PHA&#148;) with
    infrastructure in the area to insure the economics associated
    with the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    81
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    discovery prior to doing further appraisal drilling. During the
    third quarter of 2005, Pioneer and the operator of Ozona Deep
    signed a Capacity Commitment Agreement with a third party
    platform to bring future production from the discovery to the
    third party&#146;s platform. The Company anticipates entering
    into a PHA in 2006 and drilling an appraisal well during 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Oooguruk.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During 2003, the
    Company&#146;s Alaskan Oooguruk discovery wells found quantities
    of oil believed to be commercial. In 2003, the Company began
    farm-in discussions with the owner of undeveloped discoveries in
    adjacent acreage given its proximity and the potential cost
    benefits of a larger scale project. The farm-in was completed
    during 2004. Along with completing the farm-in agreement,
    Pioneer obtained access to exploration well and seismic data to
    improve the Company&#146;s understanding of the potential of the
    discoveries without having to drill additional wells. In late
    2004, the Company completed an extensive technical and economic
    evaluation of the resource potential within this area and
    authorized a front-end engineering design study (&#147;FEED
    study&#148;) for the area which was completed.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the first quarter of 2006, the Company sanctioned the
    development of the discovery and obtained the necessary
    regulatory approvals. The Company will begin operations to
    install an offshore gravel drilling and production site in order
    to complete gravel hauling activities during the 2006 winter
    construction season. Following construction of the gravel
    drilling and production site, a subsea flowline and facilities
    will be installed during 2007 to carry produced liquids to
    existing onshore processing facilities at the Kuparuk River
    Unit. Pioneer plans to drill approximately 40 horizontal wells
    to develop the discovery. Depending on weather conditions and
    facilities completion and accessibility, drilling could begin as
    early as the fall of 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Thunder Hawk.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During 2004, the
    Company&#146;s initial Thunder Hawk well found quantities of oil
    believed to be commercial. Additional appraisal wells were
    determined necessary to confirm the commercialization of the
    discovery. In the fourth quarter of 2005, the third appraisal
    well was spudded and plans to complete the drilling of the
    previously spudded second well, which was temporarily suspended
    due to weather. Completion of the drilling is expected in the
    first half of 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>South Africa.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During 2001, the Company
    drilled two South African discovery wells that found quantities
    of gas and condensate believed to be commercial. During 2004,
    2003 and 2002, the Company actively reviewed the gas supply and
    demand fundamentals in South Africa and had discussions with a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">gas-to-liquids</FONT>
    (&#147;GTL&#148;) plant in the area to purchase the condensate
    and gas. During 2004, a FEED study was authorized for the gas
    development and infrastructure design. The FEED study was
    completed in early 2005 and based on that study, the GTL plant
    operator initiated purchase orders for long-lead time
    infrastructure components. In December 2005, the Company
    announced the final approvals with its partner in the South
    Coast gas project to commence the initial development of the
    project. The project will include subsea tie-back of gas from
    the Sable field and six additional gas accumulations to the
    existing production facilities on the F-A platform for
    transportation via existing pipelines to the GTL plant.
    Production is expected to begin during the second half of 2007.
    Additional development drilling related to the project is
    expected to commence in the first quarter of 2006. As a result,
    the Company added 11.4&#160;MBOE of reserves in 2005 and reduced
    the suspended exploratory costs by approximately
    $6.2&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At December&#160;31, 2005, the remaining costs associated with
    this project relate to the Boomslang discovery, which was not
    included in the initial development of this project. Boomslang
    is both an oil and gas discovery. Continued studies of the
    commercialization of the project are ongoing. Part of the
    ongoing efforts is determining the commercialization of the
    discovery as an oil project, gas project or both. If
    commercialized as an oil discovery, earliest production would be
    2009 and if commercialized as a gas discovery, earliest
    production would be 2012.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Tunisia&#160;&#151;&#160;Anaguid.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During
    2003, the Company drilled two exploration wells on its Anaguid
    Block in Tunisia which found quantities of condensate and gas
    believed to be commercial. During 2004, the wells were scheduled
    and approved for extended production tests. However, the project
    operator delayed the extended
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    82
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    production tests due to issues unrelated to the Company or the
    project. In the third quarter of 2005, the project operator,
    along with the Company, conducted an extended production test of
    one of the two existing exploration wells and drilled an offset
    appraisal well to the other exploration well.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The results of the extended production test were unfavorable and
    the Company expensed the costs associated with this well in the
    third quarter of 2005, which were approximately
    $5.1&#160;million. However, the appraisal well offsetting the
    second discovery encountered gas and condensate in a similar
    horizon to the initial well. The Company is currently reviewing
    data from the appraisal well to determine whether development of
    the area is economical.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;E.&#160;&#160;Disclosures
    About Fair Value of Financial Instruments</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table presents the carrying amounts and estimated
    fair values of the Company&#146;s financial instruments as of
    December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="53%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, other
    current assets, accounts payable, interest payable and other
    current liabilities.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The carrying amounts
    approximate fair value due to the short maturity of these
    instruments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Commodity price swap and collar contracts, interest rate
    swaps and foreign currency swap
    contracts.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The fair value of commodity price
    swap and collar contracts, interest rate swaps and foreign
    currency contracts are

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    estimated from quotes provided by the counterparties to these
    derivative contracts and represent the estimated amounts that
    the Company would expect to receive or pay to settle the
    derivative contracts. See Note&#160;J for a description of each
    of these derivatives, including whether the derivative contract
    qualifies for hedge accounting treatment or is considered a
    speculative derivative contract.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Financial assets.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The carrying amounts
    of the trading securities approximates fair value due to the
    short maturity of these instruments. The fair value of the
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">1</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">2</FONT>&#160;percent
    note receivable due 2008 (the
    &#147;5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">1</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">2</FONT>%&#160;Note&#148;)
    was determined based on underlying market rates of interest. The
    current portion of the
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">1</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">2</FONT>%&#160;Note,
    amounting to $.4&#160;million as of December&#160;31, 2005 and
    2004, is included in other current assets, net in the
    Company&#146;s Consolidated Balance Sheets. The trading
    securities and the noncurrent portions of the
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">1</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">2</FONT>%&#160;Note
    are included in other assets, net in the Company&#146;s
    Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Long-term debt.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The carrying amount of
    borrowings outstanding under the Company&#146;s corporate credit
    facility approximates fair value because these instruments bear
    interest at variable market rates. The fair values of each of
    the senior note issuances were determined based on quoted market
    prices for each of the issues. See Note&#160;F for additional
    information regarding the Company&#146;s long-term debt.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;F.&#160;&#160;Long-term
    Debt</FONT></B>
</DIV>

    Long-term debt, including the effects of net deferred fair value
    hedges losses and issuance discounts and premiums, consisted of
    the following components at December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004:

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Lines of credit.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During September 2005,
    the Company entered into an Amended and Restated
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">5-Year</FONT>
    Revolving Credit Agreement (the &#147;Amended Credit
    Agreement&#148;) that amended the Company&#146;s
    $700&#160;million
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">5-Year</FONT>
    Revolving Credit Agreement. In connection with funding of the
    Amended Credit Agreement, all amounts outstanding under a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">364-day</FONT>
    credit facility, which was established to fund the Evergreen
    merger in September 2004, were retired and the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">364-day</FONT>
    credit facility terminated. The Amended Credit Agreement matures
    in September 2010 unless extended in accordance with the terms
    of the Amended Credit Agreement. The terms of the Amended Credit
    Agreement provide for initial aggregate loan commitments of
    $1.5&#160;billion, which may be
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    84
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    increased to a maximum aggregate amount of $1.8&#160;billion if
    the lenders increase their loan commitments or if loan
    commitments of new financial institutions are added to the
    Amended Credit Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Borrowings under the Amended Credit Agreement may be in the form
    of revolving loans or swing line loans. Aggregate outstanding
    swing line loans may not exceed $100&#160;million. Revolving
    loans bear interest, at the option of the Company, based on
    (a)&#160;a rate per annum equal to the higher of the prime rate
    announced from time to time by JPMorgan Chase Bank
    (7.25&#160;percent per annum at December&#160;31, 2005)&#160;or
    the weighted average of the rates on overnight Federal funds
    transactions with members of the Federal Reserve System during
    the last preceding business day (4.09&#160;percent per annum at
    December&#160;31, 2005) plus .5&#160;percent or (b)&#160;a base
    Eurodollar rate, substantially equal to LIBOR (4.84&#160;percent
    per annum at December&#160;31, 2005), plus a margin (the
    &#147;Applicable Margin&#148;) that is determined by reference
    to a grid based on the Company&#146;s debt rating
    (.75&#160;percent per annum at December&#160;31, 2005). The
    Applicable Margin is increased by .10&#160;percent to
    .125&#160;percent per annum, depending on the Company&#146;s
    debt ratings, if total borrowings under the Amended Credit
    Agreement exceed 50&#160;percent of the aggregate loan
    commitments. Swing line loans bear interest at a rate per annum
    equal to the &#147;ASK&#148; rate for Federal funds periodically
    published by the Dow Jones Market Service plus the Applicable
    Margin. The Company pays commitment fees on the undrawn amounts
    under the Amended Credit Agreement that are determined by
    reference to a grid based on the Company&#146;s debt rating
    (.125&#160;percent per annum at December&#160;31, 2005).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2005, the Company had $87.8&#160;million
    of undrawn letters of credit, of which $80.3&#160;million were
    undrawn commitments under the Amended Credit Agreement. The
    letters of credit outstanding under the Amended Credit Agreement
    are subject to a per annum fee, based on a grid of the
    Company&#146;s debt rating, representing the Company&#146;s
    LIBOR margin (4.84&#160;percent at December&#160;31,
    2005)&#160;plus .75&#160;percent. As of December&#160;31, 2005,
    the Company had unused borrowing capacity of $519.7&#160;million
    under the Amended Credit Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In January 2006, Moody&#146;s Investor Services, Inc.
    (&#147;Moody&#146;s&#148;) downgraded the Company from Baa3 to
    Ba1. The downgrade triggered changes in the pricing grid under
    the Amended Credit Agreement. The Applicable Margin and the
    spread on the letters of credit increased from .75&#160;percent
    to 1.00&#160;percent.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Amended Credit Agreement contains certain financial
    covenants, which include the (i)&#160;maintenance of a ratio of
    the Company&#146;s earnings before gain or loss on the
    disposition of assets, interest expense, income taxes,
    depreciation, depletion and amortization expense, exploration
    and abandonments expense and other noncash charges and expenses
    to consolidated interest expense of at least 3.5 to 1.0;
    (ii)&#160;maintenance of a ratio of total debt to book
    capitalization less intangible assets, accumulated other
    comprehensive income and certain noncash asset impairments not
    to exceed .60 to 1.0; and (iii)&#160; because  the Company fell
    below an investment grade rating by both Moody&#146;s and
    Standard&#160;&#38; Poor&#146;s Ratings Group, Inc. prior to
    attaining a mid-investment grade rating (as defined in the
    Amended Credit Agreement) by either of such rating agencies,
    then such covenants also include the maintenance of an annual
    ratio of the net present value of the Company&#146;s oil and gas
    properties to total debt of at least 1.50 to 1.0 for the first
    18&#160;months following the date of the Amended Credit
    Agreement, and 1.75 to 1.0 thereafter. The lenders may declare
    any outstanding obligations under the Amended Credit Agreement
    immediately due and payable upon the occurrence, and during the
    continuance of, an event of default, which includes a defined
    change in control of the Company. As of December&#160;31, 2005,
    the Company was in compliance with all of its debt covenants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Senior notes.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s senior
    notes are general unsecured obligations ranking equally in right
    of payment with all other senior unsecured indebtedness of the
    Company and are senior in right of payment to all existing and
    future subordinated indebtedness of the Company. The Company is
    a holding company that conducts all of its operations through
    subsidiaries; consequently, the senior notes are structurally
    subordinated to all obligations of its subsidiaries. Interest on
    the Company&#146;s senior notes is payable semiannually.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    85
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Senior convertible notes.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The
    $100&#160;million of
    4<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">3</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">4</FONT>%&#160;senior
    convertible notes due 2021 (the &#147;Convertible Notes&#148;)
    are convertible at the option of the holders. If the holders of
    the Convertible Notes do not redeem the Convertible Notes prior
    to December&#160;20, 2006 (the Company&#146;s first redemption
    right) the Company currently intends to exercise its rights
    under the indenture and redeem the Convertible Notes on such
    date for cash, common stock or a combination thereof. If the
    holders do not exercise their rights to convert the Convertible
    Notes prior to December&#160;20, 2006, the Company intends to
    refinance the cash redemption costs with unused borrowing
    capacity under the Amended Credit Agreement. The Convertible
    Notes are reflected in &#147;Thereafter&#148; in the below
    maturities table. Accordingly, the Company has classified the
    Convertible Notes as long-term in its Consolidated Balance Sheet
    as of December&#160;31, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Each $25.00 principal balance outstanding under the Convertible
    Notes is convertible into .58175&#160;shares of the
    Company&#146;s common stock plus $19.98&#160;per share, which
    includes Evergreen Kansas properties proceeds (as an example,
    each $1,000 of Convertible Notes principal would exchange for
    23.27&#160;shares of the Company&#146;s common stock plus
    $799.20 of cash). The portion of the Convertible Notes
    exchangeable into the Company&#146;s common stock is included in
    the computation of the Company&#146;s average diluted shares
    outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Early extinguishment of debt.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During
    2005, the Company (i)&#160;redeemed the remaining principal
    amounts of its outstanding
    9<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">5</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;senior
    notes due 2010 (the
    &#147;9<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">5</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;Notes&#148;)
    and its
    7<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">1</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">2</FONT>%&#160;senior
    notes due 2012 (the &#147;7.50%&#160;Notes&#148;) of
    $64.0&#160;million and $16.2, respectively, and
    (ii)&#160;accepted tenders to purchase for cash
    $188.4&#160;million in principal amount of its
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">7</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;senior
    notes due 2012 (the
    &#147;5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">7</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;Notes&#148;).
    Consequently, the Company recognized a charge for the early
    extinguishment of debt of $26.5&#160;million included in other
    expense in the accompanying Consolidated Statements of
    Operations on these redemptions and tenders for 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In addition, the Company received sufficient consents from the
    holders of the
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">7</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;Notes
    to permanently remove substantially all of the operating
    restrictions contained in the indenture governing the
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">7</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;Notes.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In conjunction with the 2004 Change of Control Offer provided as
    a result of the merger with Evergreen, the Company repurchased
    $5.5&#160;million of the
    5<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">7</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>%&#160;Notes
    during 2004. The Company recognized $.1&#160;million of other
    income associated with these debt extinguishments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2003, the Company repurchased $5.1&#160;million of its
    8<FONT style="vertical-align: top; font-size: 70&#37;">7</FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 70&#37;">8</FONT>&#160;percent
    senior notes and repaid its former revolving credit agreement
    prior to its scheduled maturity. The Company recognized
    $1.5&#160;million of charges to other expense associated with
    these debt extinguishments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;G.&#160;&#160;Related
    Party Transactions</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company, through a wholly-owned subsidiary, serves as
    operator of properties in which it and its affiliated
    partnerships have an interest. Accordingly, the Company receives
    producing well overhead, drilling well overhead and other fees
    related to the operation of the properties. The affiliated
    partnerships also reimburse the Company for their allocated
    share of general and administrative charges. Reimbursements of
    fees are recorded as reductions to general and administrative
    expenses in the Company&#146;s Consolidated Statements of
    Operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The activities with affiliated partnerships are summarized for
    the following related party transactions for the years ended
    December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;H.&#160;&#160;Incentive
    Plans</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Retirement
    Plans</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Deferred compensation retirement
    plan.</I></B>&#160;&#160;In August 1997, the Compensation
    Committee of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;)
    approved a deferred compensation retirement plan for the
    officers and certain key employees of the Company. Each officer
    and key employee is allowed to contribute up to 25&#160;percent
    of their base salary and 100&#160;percent of their annual bonus.
    The Company will provide a matching contribution of
    100&#160;percent of the officer&#146;s and key employee&#146;s
    contribution limited to the first 10&#160;percent of the
    officer&#146;s base salary and eight percent of the key
    employee&#146;s base salary. The Company&#146;s matching
    contribution vests immediately. A trust fund has been
    established by the Company to accumulate the contributions made
    under this retirement plan. The Company&#146;s matching
    contributions were $1.2&#160;million, $.9&#160;million and
    $.9&#160;million for the years ended December&#160;31, 2005,
    2004 and 2003, respectively.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    87
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>401(k) plan.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Pioneer Natural
    Resources USA, Inc. (&#147;Pioneer USA&#148;) 401(k) and
    Matching Plan (the &#147;401(k) Plan&#148;) is a defined
    contribution plan established under the Internal Revenue Code
    Section&#160;401. All regular full-time and part-time employees
    of Pioneer USA are eligible to participate in the 401(k) Plan on
    the first day of the month following their date of hire.
    Participants may contribute an amount of not less than two
    percent nor more than 30&#160;percent of their annual salary
    into the 401(k) Plan. Matching contributions are made to the
    401(k) Plan in cash by Pioneer USA in amounts equal to
    200&#160;percent of a participant&#146;s contributions to the
    401(k) Plan that are not in excess of five percent of the
    participant&#146;s base compensation (the &#147;Matching
    Contribution&#148;). Each participant&#146;s account is credited
    with the participant&#146;s contributions, their Matching
    Contributions and allocations of the 401(k) Plan&#146;s
    earnings. Participants are fully vested in their account
    balances except for Matching Contributions and their
    proportionate share of 401(k) Plan earnings attributable to
    Matching Contributions, which proportionately vest over a
    four-year period that begins with the participant&#146;s date of
    hire. During the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and
    2003, the Company recognized compensation expense of
    $8.0&#160;million, $5.4&#160;million and $4.5&#160;million,
    respectively, as a result of Matching Contributions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Long-Term
    Incentive Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In August 1997, the Company&#146;s stockholders approved a
    Long-Term Incentive Plan which provides for the granting of
    incentive awards in the form of stock options, stock
    appreciation rights, performance units and restricted stock to
    directors, officers and employees of the Company. The Long-Term
    Incentive Plan provides for the issuance of a maximum number of
    shares of common stock equal to ten percent of the total number
    of shares of common stock equivalents outstanding less the total
    number of shares of common stock subject to outstanding awards
    under any stock-based plan for the directors, officers or
    employees of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table calculates the number of shares or options
    available for grant under the Company&#146;s Long-Term Incentive
    Plan as of December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Stock option awards.</I></B>&#160;&#160;Prior to 2004, the
    Company had a program of awarding semiannual stock options to
    its employees. The Company granted 1,353,988 options under the
    Long-Term Incentive Plan during 2003.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In accordance with the Evergreen merger agreement, on
    September&#160;28, 2004, the Company assumed fully-vested
    options to purchase 2,384,657&#160;shares of the Company&#146;s
    common stock at various exercise prices, the weighted average
    price per share of which was $11.18. The assumed options were
    outstanding awards to Evergreen employees when the Evergreen
    merger occurred.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2004, the Company&#146;s stock-based compensation
    philosophy shifted its emphasis from the awarding of stock
    options to restricted stock awards. There were no options
    granted under the Long-Term Incentive Plan during 2005 or 2004.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    88
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Restricted stock awards.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During 2005,
    the Company issued 1,411,269 restricted shares of the
    Company&#146;s common stock as compensation to directors,
    officers and employees of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2004, the Company assumed 214,186 restricted stock units
    in exchange for Evergreen restricted stock units outstanding on
    September&#160;28, 2004 and issued 630,937 restricted shares of
    the Company&#146;s common stock as compensation to directors,
    officers and employees of the Company. The Company recorded
    $6.0&#160;million of deferred compensation for future expected
    service associated with certain of the restricted stock units
    assumed from Evergreen. The deferred compensation is being
    amortized as charges to compensation expense over the periods in
    which the restrictions on the units lapse.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For the 2005-2006 director year, the Company&#146;s non-employee
    directors were offered a choice to receive their annual fee
    retainers (i)&#160;100&#160;percent in restricted stock units,
    (ii)&#160;100&#160;percent in cash or (iii)&#160;a combination
    of 50/50 of cash and restricted stock units. All non-employee
    directors also received an annual equity grant of restricted
    stock units.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2003, the Company issued 77,625 restricted shares of the
    Company&#146;s common stock. The restricted share awards were
    issued as compensation to directors, officers and key employees
    of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company recorded $56.2&#160;million, $19.1&#160;million and
    $1.1&#160;million of deferred compensation associated with
    restricted stock awards in stockholders&#146; equity during
    2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively. Such amounts will be
    amortized to compensation expense over the vesting periods of
    the awards. During 2005, 2004 and 2003, amortization of
    restricted stock awards of $26.9&#160;million,
    $12.5&#160;million and $5.4&#160;million, respectively, was
    recognized as compensation expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table reflects the outstanding restricted stock
    awards as of December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003 and activity
    related thereto for the years then ended:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="39%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="6%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="5%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    The Company did not grant any stock options under the Long-Term
    Incentive Plan during 2005 or 2004.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>SFAS&#160;123 disclosures.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company
    applied APB&#160;25 and related interpretations in accounting
    for its stock option awards. Accordingly, no compensation
    expense has been recognized for its stock option awards. If
    compensation expense for the stock option awards had been
    determined consistent with SFAS&#160;123, the Company&#146;s net
    income and earnings per share would have been less than the
    reported amounts.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Under SFAS&#160;123, the fair value of each stock option grant
    is estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option
    pricing model. The Company did not grant any stock options
    during the years ended December&#160;31,
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    90
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    2005 or 2004. The following weighted average assumptions were
    used to estimate the fair value of options granted during the
    year ended December&#160;31, 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
