<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employee
    Stock Purchase Plan</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As discussed above in Note&#160;B, the Company has an ESPP that
    allows eligible employees to annually purchase the
    Company&#146;s common stock at a discounted price. Officers of
    the Company are not eligible to participate in the ESPP.
    Contributions to the ESPP are limited to 15&#160;percent of an
    employee&#146;s pay (subject to certain ESPP limits) during the
    nine-month offering period. Participants in the ESPP purchase
    the Company&#146;s common stock at a price that is
    15&#160;percent below the closing sales price of the
    Company&#146;s common stock on either the first day or the last
    day of each offering period, whichever closing sales price is
    lower.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Postretirement
    Benefit Obligations</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004, the Company had recorded
    $18.6&#160;million and $15.5&#160;million, respectively, of
    unfunded accumulated postretirement benefit obligations, the
    current and noncurrent portions of which are included in other
    current liabilities and other liabilities and minority
    interests, respectively, in the accompanying Consolidated
    Balance Sheets. These obligations are comprised of five plans of
    which four relate to predecessor entities that the Company
    acquired in prior years. These plans had no assets as of
    December&#160;31, 2005 or 2004. Other than the Company&#146;s
    retirement plan, the participants of these plans are not current
    employees of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2005, the accumulated postretirement
    benefit obligations pertaining to these plans were determined by
    independent actuaries for four plans representing
    $14.4&#160;million of unfunded accumulated postretirement
    benefit obligations and by the Company for one plan representing
    $4.2&#160;million of unfunded accumulated postretirement benefit
    obligations. Interest costs at an annual rate of
    5.75&#160;percent of the periodic undiscounted accumulated
    postretirement benefit obligations were employed in the
    valuations of the benefit obligations. Certain of the
    aforementioned plans provide for medical and dental cost
    subsidies for plan participants. Annual medical cost escalation
    trends of 10.0&#160;percent in 2006, declining to
    5.0&#160;percent in 2011 and thereafter, and annual dental cost
    escalation trends of 6.5&#160;percent in 2006, declining to
    5.0&#160;percent in 2009 and thereafter, were employed to
    estimate the accumulated postretirement benefit obligations
    associated with the medical and dental cost subsidies.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table reconciles changes in the Company&#146;s
    unfunded accumulated postretirement benefit obligations during
    the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Estimated benefit payments and service/interest costs associated
    with the plans for the year ending December&#160;31, 2006 are
    $1.5&#160;million and $1.9&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;I.&#160;&#160;Commitments
    and Contingencies</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Severance agreements.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company has
    entered into severance and change in control agreements with its
    officers, subsidiary company officers and certain key employees.
    Salaries and bonuses for the Company&#146;s officers are set by
    the Board for the parent company officers and by the
    Company&#146;s management committee for subsidiary company
    officers and key employees. The Board and management committee
    can grant increases or reductions to base salary at their
    discretion. The current annual salaries for the parent company
    officers, the subsidiary company officers and key employees
    covered under such agreements total $33.2&#160;million.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Indemnifications.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company has
    indemnified its directors and certain of its officers, employees
    and agents with respect to claims and damages arising from acts
    or omissions taken in such capacity, as well as with respect to
    certain litigation.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Legal actions.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company is party to
    the legal proceedings that are described below. The Company is
    also party to other proceedings and claims incidental to its
    business. While many of these matters involve inherent
    uncertainty, the Company believes that the amount of the
    liability, if any, ultimately incurred with respect to such
    other proceedings and claims will not have a material adverse
    effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position as
    a whole or on its liquidity, capital resources or future annual
    results of operations. The Company will continue to evaluate its
    litigation matters on a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">quarter-by-quarter</FONT>
    basis and will adjust its litigation reserves as appropriate to
    reflect its assessment of the then current status of litigation.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Alford.</I>&#160;&#160;The Company is party to a 1993 class
    action lawsuit filed in the 26th&#160;Judicial District Court of
    Stevens County, Kansas by two classes of royalty owners, one for
    each of the Company&#146;s gathering systems connected to the
    Company&#146;s Satanta gas plant. The case was relatively
    inactive for several years. In early 2000, the plaintiffs
    amended their pleadings and the case now contains two material
    claims. First, the plaintiffs assert that they were improperly
    charged expenses (primarily field compression), which plaintiffs
    allege are a &#147;cost of production&#148;, and for which the
    plaintiffs claim they, as royalty owners, are not responsible.
    Second, the plaintiffs claim they are entitled to
    50&#160;percent to 100&#160;percent of the value of the helium
    extracted at the Company&#146;s Satanta gas plant. If the
    plaintiffs were to prevail on the above two claims in their
    entirety, it is possible that the Company&#146;s liability (both
    for periods covered by the lawsuit and from the last date
    covered by the lawsuit to the present&#160;&#151;&#160;because
    the deductions continue to be taken and the plaintiffs continue
    to be paid for a royalty share of the helium) could reach
    approximately $35&#160;million related to the cost of production
    claim and approximately $18&#160;million to $43&#160;million
    related to the helium claim, plus prejudgment interest. However,
    the Company believes it has valid defenses to the
    plaintiffs&#146; claims and has paid the plaintiffs properly
    under their respective oil and gas leases and other agreements,
    and intends to vigorously defend itself.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company does not believe the costs it has deducted are a
    &#147;cost of production&#148;. The costs being deducted are
    post production costs incurred to transport the gas to the
    Company&#146;s Satanta gas plant for processing, where the
    valuable hydrocarbon liquids and helium are extracted from the
    gas. The plaintiffs benefit from such extractions and the
    Company believes that charging the plaintiffs with their
    proportionate share of such transportation and processing
    expenses is consistent with Kansas law and with the
    parties&#146; agreements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company has also vigorously defended against
    plaintiffs&#146; claims for 100&#160;percent of the value of the
    helium extracted, and believes that in accordance with
    applicable law, it has properly accounted to the plaintiffs for
    their fractional royalty share of the helium under the specified
    royalty clauses of the respective oil and gas leases. In more
    recent filings with the court, plaintiffs asserted that an equal
    division between Pioneer and its royalty owners of the proceeds
    from helium would provide the most equitable result. The Company
    has not established a provision for the helium claim.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    92
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The factual evidence in the case was presented to the
    26th&#160;Judicial District Court without a jury in December
    2001. Oral arguments were heard by the court in April 2002, and
    although the court has not yet entered a judgment or findings,
    it could do so at any time. The Company strongly denies the
    existence of any material underpayment to the plaintiffs and
    believes it presented strong evidence at trial to support its
    positions. However, either through a negotiated settlement or
    court ruling, the Company could have to pay some part of the
    cost of production claim and, accordingly, the Company has
    established a partial reserve for this claim. Although the
    amount of any resulting liability, to the extent that it exceeds
    the Company&#146;s provision, could have a material adverse
    effect on the Company&#146;s results of operations for the
    quarterly reporting period in which such liability is recorded,
    the Company does not expect that any such additional liability
    will have a material adverse effect on its consolidated
    financial position as a whole or on its liquidity, capital
    resources or future annual results of operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>MOSH Holding.</I>&#160;&#160;The Company and its principal
    United States subsidiary, Pioneer USA, were named as defendants
    in <I>MOSH Holding, L.P. v Pioneer Natural Resources Company;
    Pioneer Natural Resources USA, Inc.; Woodside Energy (USA) Inc.;
    and JPMorgan Chase Bank, NA, as Trustee of the Mesa Offshore
    Trust</I>, which was filed on April&#160;11, 2005, in the
    District Court of Travis County, Texas (250th&#160;Judicial
    District). The plaintiff is a unitholder in the Mesa Offshore
    Trust, which was created in 1982 as the sole limited partner in
    a partnership that holds an overriding royalty interest in
    certain oil and gas leases offshore Louisiana and Texas. The
    plaintiff alleges that the Company, together with Woodside
    Energy (USA) Inc. (&#147;Woodside&#148;), concealed the value of
    the royalty interest and worked to terminate the Mesa Offshore
    Trust prematurely and to capture for itself and Woodside profits
    that belong to the Mesa Offshore Trust. The plaintiff also
    alleges breaches of fiduciary duty, misapplication of trust
    property, common law fraud, gross negligence, and breach of the
    conveyance agreement for the overriding royalty interest. The
    claims appear to relate principally to farmout arrangements
    established in 2003 for two offshore properties, the Brazos Area
    Block <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">A-7</FONT>
    and Brazos Area Block
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">A-39.</FONT> The
    relief sought by the plaintiff includes monetary and punitive
    damages and certain equitable relief, including an accounting of
    expenses, a setting aside of certain farmouts, and a temporary
    and permanent injunction. The Company believes the claims are
    without merit and intends to defend the lawsuit vigorously.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Argentine Environmental.</I>&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s
    subsidiary in Argentina is involved in various administrative
    proceedings with environmental authorities in the Neuquen
    Province relating to permits for and discharges from operations
    in that province. The Company&#146;s subsidiary is cooperating
    with the proceedings, although it from time to time challenges
    whether certain assessed fines are appropriate. The Company
    estimates that fines assessed in these proceedings will be
    immaterial, but in the aggregate could exceed $100,000. The
    Company&#146;s subsidiary in Argentina has also been named in a
    suit against various oil companies operating in the Neuquen
    basin entitled <I>Asociaci&#243;n de Superficiarios de la
    Patagonia&#160;v. YPF S.A.</I>, <I>et. al.</I>, originally filed
    on August&#160;21, 2003, in the Argentine National Supreme Court
    of Justice. The plaintiffs, a private group of landowners, have
    also named the national government and several provinces as
    third parties. The lawsuit alleges injury to the environment
    generally by the oil and gas industry without specifically
    alleging how any of the defendants caused this injury. The
    plaintiffs principally seek creation of an insured fund to
    remediate the environment. The Company&#146;s subsidiary intends
    to defend itself in the case. Although the suit is at an early
    procedural stage and appears to involve novel theories, the
    Company does not expect that any such additional liability will
    have a material adverse effect on its consolidated financial
    position as a whole or on its liquidity, capital resources or
    future annual results of operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Dorchester Refining Company Site.</I>&#160;&#160;A subsidiary
    of the Company has been notified by a letter from the Texas
    Commission on Environmental Quality (&#147;TCEQ&#148;) dated
    August&#160;24, 2005 that the TCEQ considers the subsidiary to
    be a potentially responsible party with respect to the
    Dorchester Refining Company State Superfund Site located in
    Mount Pleasant, Texas. In connection with the acquisition of oil
    and gas assets in 1991, the Company acquired a group of
    companies, one of which was an entity that had owned a refinery
    located at the Mount Pleasant site from 1977 until 1984.
    According to the TCEQ, this refinery was responsible for
    releases of hazardous substances into the environment. Pursuant
    to applicable Texas law, the Company&#146;s subsidiary, which
    does not own any material assets or conduct any material
    operations, may be subject to strict, joint and several
    liability for the costs of conducting a
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    93
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    study to evaluate potential remedial options and for the costs
    of performing any remediation ultimately required by the TCEQ.
    The Company does not know the nature and extent of the alleged
    contamination, the potential costs of remediation, or the
    portion, if any, of such costs that may be allocable to the
    Company&#146;s subsidiary; however, the Company has noted that
    there appear to be other operators or owners who may share
    responsibility for these costs and does not expect that any such
    additional liability will have a material adverse effect on its
    consolidated financial position as a whole or on its liquidity,
    capital resources or future annual results of operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Environmental Protection Agency
    Investigation.</I>&#160;&#160;On November&#160;4, 2005, the
    Company learned from the U.S.&#160;Environmental Protection
    Agency that the agency was conducting a criminal investigation
    into a 2003 spill that occurred at a Company-operated drilling
    rig located on an ice island offshore Kuparuk in Harrison Bay,
    Alaska. The investigation is being conducted in conjunction with
    the U.S. Attorney&#146;s Office for the District of Alaska. The
    spill was previously investigated by the Alaska Department of
    Environmental Conservation (&#147;ADEC&#148;) and, following
    completion of a clean up, the ADEC issued a letter stating its
    determination that, at that time, the site did not pose a threat
    to human health, safety, or welfare or the environment. The
    Company is cooperating in the government&#146;s investigation.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Lease agreements.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company leases
    offshore production facilities, drilling rigs, equipment and
    office facilities under noncancellable operating leases. Rental
    expenses associated with these operating leases for the years
    ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003 were approximately
    $64.5&#160;million, $51.8&#160;million and $15.5&#160;million,
    respectively. Future minimum lease commitments under
    noncancellable operating leases at December&#160;31, 2005 are as
    follows (in thousands):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    <FONT style="font-size: 10pt">2006
    </FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Drilling commitments.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company
    periodically enters into contractual arrangements under which
    the Company is committed to expend funds to drill wells in the
    future. The Company also enters into agreements to secure
    drilling rig services, which require the Company to make future
    minimum payments to the rig operators. The Company records
    drilling commitments in the periods in which well capital is
    expended or rig services are provided.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Transportation agreements.</I></B>&#160;&#160;Associated
    with the Evergreen merger, the Company assumed gas
    transportation commitments for specified volumes of gas per year
    through 2014. During 2005, the Company expanded these
    commitments to support production increases, primarily in the
    Raton gas field. The transportation commitments averaged
    approximately 147&#160;million cubic feet (&#147;MMcf&#148;) of
    gross gas sales volumes per day during 2005, including
    associated fuel commitments. These commitments will average
    approximately 196&#160;MMcf of gross gas volumes per day during
    2006, increase to approximately 200&#160;MMcf of gross gas
    volumes per day during 2007, and decline thereafter to
    approximately 41&#160;MMcf of gross gas volumes per day during
    2014.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s Canadian subsidiaries are parties to pipeline
    transportation service agreements, with aggregate remaining
    terms of approximately 10&#160;years, whereby they have
    committed to transport specified volumes of gas each year
    principally from Canada to a point in Chicago, Illinois. Such
    gas volumes totalled approximately 78&#160;MMcf of gas per day
    during 2005, 2004 and 2003, and are comprised of a significant
    portion of the Company&#146;s Canadian net gas production,
    augmented with certain volumes purchased at market prices in
    Canada. The committed volumes to be transported under the
    pipeline transportation service agreements are approximately
    86&#160;MMcf of gas per day during 2006 and decline to
    approximately 75&#160;MMcf of gas per day by the end of the
    commitment term. The net gas marketing gains or losses resulting
    from purchasing third party gas in
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    94
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

    Canada and selling it in Chicago are recorded as other income or
    other expense in the accompanying Consolidated Statements of
    Operations. Associated with these agreements, the Company
    recognized $4.1&#160;million of gas marketing gains in other
    income during the year ended December&#160;31, 2005 and
    $1.2&#160;million and $.9&#160;million, respectively, of gas
    marketing losses in other expense during the years ended
    December&#160;31, 2004 and 2003.
</DIV>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;J.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Derivative
    Financial Instruments</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Fair value hedges.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company monitors
    the debt capital markets and interest rate trends to identify
    opportunities to enter into and terminate interest rate swap
    contracts with the objective of reducing costs of capital.
    During the three-year period ending December&#160;31, 2005, the
    Company entered into interest rate swap contracts to hedge a
    portion of the fair value of its senior notes. During the year
    ended December&#160;31, 2004, the Company paid
    $9.4&#160;million, net of $2.2&#160;million of associated
    settlements receivable, to terminate fair value hedge interest
    rate swaps prior to their stated maturities. Associated
    therewith, the Company recognized $11.6&#160;million of
    &#147;Payments of other liabilities&#148; in the accompanying
    Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows for the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2004. During the year ended December&#160;31,
    2003, the Company terminated fair value hedge interest rate swap
    contracts for cash proceeds, including accrued interest, of
    $21.5&#160;million. The proceeds attributable to the fair value
    of the remaining terms of the terminated contracts amounted to
    $18.3&#160;million and are included in &#147;Proceeds from
    disposition of assets&#148; in the accompanying Consolidated
    Statements of Cash Flows during the year ended December&#160;31,
    2003. During the years ended December&#160;31, 2004 and 2003,
    settlements of open fair value hedges reduced the Company&#146;s
    interest expense by $2.2&#160;million and $3.2&#160;million,
    respectively. As of December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004, the Company
    was not a party to any open fair value hedges.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of December&#160;31, 2005, the carrying value of the
    Company&#146;s long-term debt in the accompanying Consolidated
    Balance Sheets included a $4.3&#160;million reduction in the
    carrying value attributable to net deferred hedge losses on
    terminated fair value hedges that are being amortized as net
    increases to interest expense over the original terms of the
    terminated agreements. The amortization of net deferred hedge
    gains on terminated interest rate swaps reduced the
    Company&#146;s reported interest expense by $4.1&#160;million,
    $19.2&#160;million and $26.1&#160;million during the years ended
    December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table sets forth, as of December&#160;31, 2005,
    the scheduled amortization of net deferred hedge gains (losses)
    on terminated interest rate hedges (including terminated fair
    value and cash flow hedges) that will be recognized as increases
    in the case of losses, or decreases in the case of gains, to the
    Company&#146;s future interest expense:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Cash flow hedges.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company utilizes
    commodity swap and collar contracts to (i)&#160;reduce the
    effect of price volatility on the commodities the Company
    produces and sells, (ii)&#160;support the Company&#146;s annual
    capital
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    budgeting and expenditure plans and (iii)&#160;reduce commodity
    price risk associated with certain capital projects. As of
    December&#160;31, 2005, all of the Company&#146;s open commodity
    hedges are designated as hedges of Canadian and United States
    forecasted sales. The Company also, from time to time, utilizes
    interest rate contracts to reduce the effect of interest rate
    volatility on the Company&#146;s indebtedness and forward
    currency exchange agreements to reduce the effect of
    U.S.&#160;dollar to Canadian dollar exchange rate volatility.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Oil prices.</I></B>&#160;&#160;All material physical sales
    contracts governing the Company&#146;s oil production have been
    tied directly or indirectly to the New York Mercantile Exchange
    (&#147;NYMEX&#148;) prices. As of December&#160;31, 2005, all of
    the Company&#146;s oil hedges were designated as hedges of
    United States forecasted sales. The following table sets forth
    the volumes hedged in barrels (&#147;Bbl&#148;) underlying the
    Company&#146;s outstanding oil hedge contracts and the weighted
    average NYMEX prices per Bbl for those contracts as of
    December&#160;31, 2005:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <TD valign="bottom">
    Subsequent to December&#160;31, 2005, the Company reduced its
    oil hedge positions by terminating the following oil swap and
    collar contracts which are included in the table above:
    (i)&#160;2,000&#160;Bbls per day of March through December 2006
    swap contracts with a fixed price of $26.29 per Bbl;
    1,000&#160;Bbls per day of calendar 2007 swap contracts with a
    fixed price of $31.00 per Bbl; and 2,000&#160;Bbls per day of
    calendar 2008 swap contracts with a fixed price of $30.00 per
    Bbl and (ii)&#160;2,000&#160;Bbls per day of March through
    December 2006 collar contracts having a floor price of $50.00
    per Bbl and a ceiling price of $96.25 per Bbl and
    2,500&#160;Bbls per day of calendar 2007 collar contracts having
    a floor price of $50.00 and ceiling prices of $91.18 per Bbl.</TD>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    effects of oil quality adjustments and the net effect of oil
    hedges. The following table sets forth the Company&#146;s oil

    <TD align="left" valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Excludes hedge losses of $11.1&#160;million, $10.2&#160;million
    and $2.4&#160;million attributable to discontinued operations
    for the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
    respectively.</TD>
</TR>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Natural gas liquids prices.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During the
    years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, the Company
    did not enter into any NGL hedge contracts. There were no
    outstanding NGL hedge contracts at December&#160;31, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Gas prices.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company employs a
    policy of hedging a portion of its gas production based on the
    index price upon which the gas is actually sold in order to
    mitigate the basis risk between NYMEX prices and actual index
    prices, or based on NYMEX prices if NYMEX prices are highly
    correlated with the index price. As of December&#160;31, 2005,
    all of the Company&#146;s gas hedges were designated as hedges
    of United States and Canadian forecasted sales. The following
    table sets forth the volumes hedged in million British thermal
    units (&#147;MMBtu&#148;) under outstanding gas hedge contracts
    and the weighted average index prices per MMBtu for those
    contracts as of December&#160;31, 2005:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="35%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="9%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="9%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company reports average gas prices per thousand cubic feet
    (&#147;Mcf&#148;) including the effects of British thermal unit
    (&#147;Btu&#148;) content, gas processing, shrinkage adjustments
    and the net effect of gas hedges. The following table sets forth
    the Company&#146;s gas prices from continuing operations, both
    reported (including hedge results) and realized (excluding hedge
    results), and the net effect of settlements of gas price hedges
    on gas revenue for the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004
    and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Excludes hedge losses of $10.8&#160;million and
    $4.3&#160;million attributable to discontinued operations for
    the years ended December&#160;31, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Hedge ineffectiveness.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During the years
    ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, the Company
    recognized ineffectiveness charges to other expense of
    $54.8&#160;million, $4.3&#160;million and $2.8&#160;million,
    respectively, related to the ineffective portions of its cash
    flow hedging instruments. These charges include amounts related
    to (i)&#160;hedged volumes that exceeded revised forecasts of
    production volumes due to delays in the start up of production
    in certain fields and (ii)&#160;reduced correlations between the
    indexes of the financial hedge derivatives and the indexes of
    the hedged forecasted production for certain fields.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging.</I></B>&#160;&#160;As of
    December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004, AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging
    represented net deferred losses of $506.6 and
    $241.4&#160;million, respectively. The
    AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging balance as of December&#160;31,
    2005 was comprised of $767.8&#160;million of net deferred losses
    on the effective portions of open cash flow hedges,
    $30.0&#160;million of net deferred losses on terminated cash
    flow hedges (including $3.2&#160;million of net deferred losses
    on terminated cash flow interest rate hedges) and
    $291.2&#160;million of associated net deferred tax benefits. The
    AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging balance as of December&#160;31,
    2004 was comprised of $363.1&#160;million of net deferred losses
    on the effective portions of open cash flow hedges,
    $3.0&#160;million of net deferred losses on terminated cash flow
    hedges (including $3.4&#160;million of net deferred losses on
    terminated cash flow interest rate hedges) and
    $124.7&#160;million of associated net deferred tax benefits. The
    increase in AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging during the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2005 was primarily attributable to increases
    in future commodity prices relative to the commodity prices
    stipulated in the hedge contracts, partially offset by the
    reclassification of net deferred hedge losses to net income as
    derivatives matured by their terms. The net deferred losses
    associated with open cash flow hedges remain subject to market
    price fluctuations until the positions are either settled under
    the terms of the hedge contracts or terminated prior to
    settlement. The net deferred losses on terminated cash flow
    hedges are fixed.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the year ending December&#160;31, 2006, based on current
    estimates of future commodity prices, the Company expects to
    reclassify $308.3&#160;million of net deferred losses associated
    with open commodity hedges and $6.2&#160;million of net deferred
    losses on terminated commodity hedges from
    AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging to oil and gas revenues. The
    Company also expects to reclassify approximately
    $114.8&#160;million of net deferred income tax benefits
    associated with commodity hedges during the year ending
    December&#160;31, 2006 from AOCI&#160;&#151;&#160;Hedging to
    income tax benefit.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    98
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Non-hedge derivatives.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During January
    and April&#160;2005, the Company entered into non-hedge interest
    rate swaps. The Company terminated the interest rate swaps
    during January and April&#160;2005 for an aggregate net loss of
    $1.5&#160;million, which amount is included in other expense in
    the Company&#146;s accompanying Consolidated Statement of
    Operations for 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;K.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Major
    Customers and Derivative Counterparties</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Sales to major customers.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The
    Company&#146;s share of oil and gas production is sold to
    various purchasers who must be prequalified under the
    Company&#146;s credit risk policies and procedures. The Company
    records allowances for doubtful accounts based on the agings of
    accounts receivable and the general economic condition of its
    customers. The Company is of the opinion that the loss of any
    one purchaser would not have an adverse effect on the ability of
    the Company to sell its oil and gas production.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    There were not any customers who individually accounted for ten
    percent or more of the consolidated oil, NGL and gas revenues of
    the Company during the year ended December&#160;31, 2005. The
    following customer individually accounted for ten percent or
    more of the consolidated oil, NGL and gas revenues of the
    Company, including the revenues from discontinued operations and
    the results of commodity hedges, during the years ended
    December&#160;31, 2004 and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Derivative counterparties.</I></B>&#160;&#160;The Company
    uses credit and other financial criteria to evaluate the credit
    standing of, and to select, counterparties to its derivative
    instruments. Although the Company does not obtain collateral or
    otherwise secure the fair value of its derivative instruments,
    associated credit risk is mitigated by the Company&#146;s credit
    risk policies and procedures. As of December&#160;31, 2005 and
    2004, the Company had $7.3&#160;million of derivative assets for
    which Enron North America Corp was the Company&#146;s
    counterparty. Associated therewith, the Company had a
    $6.4&#160;million allowance for doubtful accounts as of
    December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004. In January 2006, the Company
    sold the Enron receivables for $3.0&#160;million and will
    recognize a gain of $2.1&#160;million in 2006.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    99
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;L.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Asset
    Retirement Obligations</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As referred to in Note&#160;B, the Company adopted the
    provisions of SFAS&#160;143 on January&#160;1, 2003. The
    Company&#146;s asset retirement obligations primarily relate to
    the future plugging and abandonment of proved properties and
    related facilities. The Company does not provide for a market
    risk premium associated with asset retirement obligations
    because a reliable estimate cannot be determined. The Company
    has no assets that are legally restricted for purposes of
    settling asset retirement obligations. The following table
    summarizes the Company&#146;s asset retirement obligation
    transactions recorded in accordance with the provisions of
    SFAS&#160;143 during the years ended December&#160;31, 2005,
    2004 and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row -->

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Includes, for the year ended December&#160;31, 2005, a
    $39.8&#160;million increase in the abandonment estimate of the
    East Cameron facilities that were destroyed by Hurricane Rita,
    which is reflected in exploration and abandonments expense in
    the Consolidated Statements of Operations.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company records the current and noncurrent portions of asset
    retirement obligations in other current liabilities and other
    liabilities and minority interests, respectively, in the
    accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    100
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    The Company&#146;s operations in Argentina, Canada and Africa
    periodically recognize monetary assets and liabilities in
    currencies other than their functional currencies (see
    Note&#160;B for information regarding the functional currencies
    of subsidiary entities). Associated therewith, the Company
    realizes foreign currency remeasurement and transaction gains
    and losses.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;N.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Asset
    Divestitures</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
    the Company completed asset divestitures for net proceeds of
    $1.2&#160;billion, $1.7&#160;million and $35.7&#160;million,
    respectively. Associated therewith, the Company recorded gains
    on disposition of assets in continuing operations of
    $60.5&#160;million, $39,000 and $1.3&#160;million during the
    years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively,
    and gains of $166.1&#160;million in discontinued operations in
    2005. The following represent the significant divestitures:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Volumetric production payments.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During
    2005, the Company sold three volumetric production payments
    (&#147;VPPs&#148;) for proceeds of $892.6&#160;million for which
    no gain or loss was recognized. See Note&#160;T for additional
    information.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Canadian and Gulf of Mexico Shelf
    divestitures.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During 2005, the Company sold
    its interests in (a)&#160;the Martin Creek, Conroy Black and
    Lookout Butte areas in Canada for net proceeds of
    $197.2&#160;million, resulting in a gain of $138.3&#160;million
    and (b)&#160;certain assets on the Gulf of Mexico shelf for net
    proceeds of $59.1&#160;million, resulting in a gain of
    $27.7&#160;million. Pursuant to SFAS&#160;144, the gain and the
    results of operations from these assets have been reclassified
    to discontinued operations. See Note&#160;V for additional
    information.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>East Texas divestiture.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During the year
    ended December&#160;31, 2005, the Company sold its interests in
    certain East Texas properties for $25.3&#160;million of net cash
    proceeds with no corresponding gain or loss recognized.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    101
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Gabon divestiture.</I></B>&#160;&#160;In October 2005, the
    Company closed the sale of the shares in a Gabonese subsidiary
    that owns the interest in the Olowi block for $47.9&#160;million
    of net proceeds. A gain was recognized during the fourth quarter
    of 2005 of $47.5&#160;million with no associated income tax
    effect either in Gabon or the United States. In addition,
    Pioneer retains the potential, under certain circumstances, to
    receive additional payments for production from deeper
    reservoirs discovered on the block.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B><I>Hedge derivative divestitures.</I></B>&#160;&#160;During
    the year ended December&#160;31, 2003, the Company terminated,
    prior to their scheduled maturity, hedge derivatives for cash
    sales proceeds of $18.3&#160;million. Net gains from these
    divestitures were deferred and are amortized over the original
    contract lives of the terminated derivatives as reductions to
    interest expense or increases to oil and gas revenues. See
    Note&#160;J for more information regarding deferred gains and
    losses on terminated hedge derivatives.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <TD width="90%"></TD>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    The Company&#146;s operations in Argentina, Canada and Africa
    periodically recognize monetary assets and liabilities in
    currencies other than their functional currencies (see
    Note&#160;B for information regarding the functional currencies
    of subsidiary entities). Associated therewith, the Company
    realizes foreign currency remeasurement and transaction gains
    and losses.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;P.&#160;&#160;Income
    Taxes</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with the
    provisions of SFAS&#160;No.&#160;109, &#147;Accounting for
    Income Taxes&#148; (&#147;SFAS&#160;109&#148;). The Company and
    its eligible subsidiaries file a consolidated United States
    federal income tax return. Certain subsidiaries are not eligible
    to be included in the consolidated United States federal income
    tax return and separate provisions for income taxes have been
    determined for these entities or groups of entities. The tax
    returns and the amount of taxable income or loss are subject to
    examination by United States
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    102
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    federal, state, local and foreign taxing authorities. Current
    and estimated tax payments of $44.7&#160;million,
    $17.1&#160;million and $5.3&#160;million were made during the
    years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    SFAS&#160;109 requires that the Company continually assess both
    positive and negative evidence to determine whether it is more
    likely than not that deferred tax assets can be realized prior
    to their expiration. Pioneer monitors Company-specific, oil and
    gas industry and worldwide economic factors and assesses the
    likelihood that the Company&#146;s net operating loss
    carryforwards (&#147;NOLs&#148;) and other deferred tax
    attributes in the United States, state, local and foreign tax
    jurisdictions will be utilized prior to their expiration. As of
    December&#160;31, 2005 and 2004, the Company&#146;s valuation
    allowances related to foreign and domestic tax jurisdictions
    were $95.8&#160;million and $108.2&#160;million, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In October 2004, the American Jobs Creation Act (the
    &#147;AJCA&#148;) was signed into law. The AJCA includes a
    deduction of 85&#160;percent of qualified foreign earnings that
    are repatriated, as defined in the AJCA. During 2005, the
    Company determined that it was advantageous to apply the
    provisions of the AJCA to qualified foreign earnings that could
    be repatriated. The Company formalized repatriation plans in
    2005 and repatriated $322.5&#160;million from Canada, South
    Africa and Tunisia. Based on the current understanding of the
    provisions of the AJCA, the Company estimates that approximately
    $170.7&#160;million of the repatriated funds qualify for the
    dividend exclusion. The Company is obligated by the provisions
    of the AJCA to invest the qualifying dividends in the United
    States within a reasonable period of time. The cash tax
    liability associated with the qualifying dividends is
    approximately $9.3&#160;million for 2005. During the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2005, the Company recognized income tax
    expense of $6.8&#160;million related to continuing operations
    and $19.6&#160;million related to discontinued operations
    associated with the repatriations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s income tax provision (benefit) and amounts
    separately allocated were attributable to the following items
    for the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="66%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="7%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="6%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->
    <TD width="7%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=hang1 -->
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom" align="center">
<TD nowrap align="center" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD colspan="10" align="center" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000">
    <B><FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Year Ended
    December&#160;31,</FONT></B>
</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%; align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=455 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    The Company has applied an inflation adjustment to its Argentine
    income tax returns since 2002 based on developing case law. The
    Company believes that it is more likely than not that the
    adjustment will be denied by the Argentine taxing authorities
    and has provided a $58.9&#160;million valuation allowance
    against this tax benefit in its overall foreign valuation
    allowances as of December&#160;31, 2005.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    105
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At December&#160;31, 2005, the Company had NOLs for United
    States, South Africa and other African countries for income tax
    purposes as set forth below, which are available to offset
    future regular taxable income in each respective tax
    jurisdiction, if any. Additionally, the Company has alternative
    minimum tax NOLs (&#147;AMT NOLs&#148;) in the United States
    which are available to reduce future alternative minimum taxable
    income, if any. These carryforwards expire as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (a) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    The Company believes that it is more likely than not that these
    other African NOLs will not offset future taxable income and has
    provided a valuation allowance against these deferred tax assets.</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company believes $100&#160;million of the U.S.&#160;NOLs and
    AMT NOLs are subject to Section&#160;382 of the Internal Revenue
    Code and are limited in each taxable year to approximately
    $20&#160;million. During the years ended
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    106
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">PIONEER
    NATURAL RESOURCES COMPANY<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">December&#160;31,
    2005, 2004 and 2003</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and 2003, the Company utilized
    $354.9&#160;million, $151.1&#160;million and $16.3&#160;million
    of NOLs, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;Q.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Income
    Per Share From Continuing Operations Before Cumulative Effect of
    Change in Accounting Principle </FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Basic income per share from continuing operations before
    cumulative effect of change in accounting principle is computed
    by dividing income from continuing operations before cumulative
    effect of change in accounting principle by the weighted average
    number of common shares outstanding for the period. The
    computation of diluted income per share from continuing
    operations before cumulative effect of change in accounting
    principle reflects the potential dilution that could occur if
    securities or other contracts to issue common stock that are
    dilutive to income from continuing operations before cumulative
    effect of change in accounting principle were exercised or
    converted into common stock or resulted in the issuance of
    common stock that would then share in the earnings of the
    Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table is a reconciliation of the basic income from
    continuing operations before cumulative effect of change in
    accounting principle to diluted income from continuing
    operations before cumulative effect of change in accounting
    principle for the years ended December&#160;31, 2005, 2004 and
    2003:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
